verses.verse: For the Chief Musician; on stringed instruments. A Psalm of Asaph, a Song. In Judah<WH3063> is God<WH430> known<WH3045>: His name<WH8034> is great<WH1419> in Israel<WH3478>.
In Salem<WH8004> also is his tabernacle<WH5520>, And his dwelling-place<WH4585> in Zion<WH6726>.
There he brake<WH7665> the arrows<WH7565> of the bow<WH7198>; The shield<WH4043>, and the sword<WH2719>, and the battle<WH4421>. <WH5542>[[Selah
Glorious <WH215> art thou and excellent<WH117>, From the mountains<WH2042> of prey<WH2964>.
The stouthearted<WH47> are made a spoil<WH7997>, They have slept<WH5123> their sleep<WH8142>; And none of the men<WH582> of might<WH2428> have found<WH4672> their hands<WH3027>.
At thy rebuke<WH1606>, O God<WH430> of Jacob<WH3290>, Both chariot<WH7393> and horse<WH5483> are cast into a deep sleep<WH7290>.
Thou <WH3372>, even thou, art to be feared; And who may stand<WH5975> in thy sight<WH6440> when<WH227> once thou art angry<WH639>?
Thou didst cause sentence<WH1779> to be heard<WH8085> from heaven<WH8064>; The earth<WH776> feared<WH3372>, and was still<WH8252>,
When God<WH430> arose<WH6965> to judgment<WH4941>, To save<WH3467> all the meek<WH6035> of the earth<WH776>. <WH5542>[[Selah
Surely the wrath<WH2534> of man<WH120> shall praise<WH3034> thee<WH7611>: The residue of wrath<WH2534> shalt thou gird upon thee<WH2296>.
Vow <WH5087>, and pay<WH7999> unto Jehovah<WH3068> your God<WH430>: Let all that are round about<WH5439> him bring<WH2986> presents<WH7862> unto him that ought to be feared<WH4172>.
He will cut off<WH1219> the spirit<WH7307> of princes<WH5057>: He is terrible<WH3372> to the kings<WH4428> of the earth<WH776>.
